result.execSummary:
The defendant Darnell Stith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any sentence; release to the Day Reporting Center only; credit for 4 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Court has no objection after the first 6 months of success in participation in the Day Reporting Center.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, during course of probation to the probation agent. Any cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant seek and maintain full time work.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.
Defendant may not reside at any location where a firearm is kept.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, taken in the manner and fashion prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering, or for distribution.
Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.

Court orderer defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already done.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
Defendant must attend at least two Alcohol and Drug assessment  treatments or sobriety groups per month.
Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnell Stith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darnell Stith in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1 of the Amended Information -
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release to the Day Reporting Center only; credit for 4 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Court has no objection after the first 6 months of success in participation in the Day Reporting Center. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 1YEAR with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant must attend at least two Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  treatment or sobriety support group per month.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not reside at any location where a firearm is kept.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.
- Defendant to seek and maintain full time work.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including
  the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. 
  Any cash bail on deposit to apply.
  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due
  or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Amended Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant wished to plead not guilty.
Defendant is charged as follows COUNT 1 Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance (THC) (200 Grams or Less/4 Plants or Less), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(1m)(h)1, 939.50 (3)(i), a Class I Felony.

Defendant Darnell Stith in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea Hearing. Case held off the record as the Court is in a Jury Trial on another matter. Case is adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 1-22-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darnell Stith in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea Hearing. Case held off the record as the Court is in a Jury Trial on another matter. Defense requests an adjourned Plea Hearing date to review with Defendant. Case is adjourned for Plea Hearing on 12-8-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darnell Stith in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case heard off the record as the Court is in a Jury Trial. Defense requests case be set for Plea Hearing. Case is adjourned for Plea Hearing on 11-12-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 634
cf

Defendant Darnell Stith in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Judge Fiorenza for Judge Stark.

Motion hearing proceeded.  Court finds there is no basis to hear a motion on the stop for reasons stated on the record.  Court proceeds on motion for the search.
Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer, Amy Bartol.  Exhibit 1 received.  State rests, subject to rebuttal.  Court held colloquy with defendant on his right to testfiy and right not to testify.  Defendant waives right to testify.  Evidentiary phase is complete.  Closing arguments made.  Court DENIES motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record.  Case adjourned for status before Judge Stark, branch 17, on 10/15/2014 at 1:30 pm.  aw  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darnell Stith in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Effective August 3, 2014, this case will be assigned to Judge Carolina Stark, Branch 17, Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Defense advised the court on 7-30-14 that they will be relying on previously filed Motion to Suppress (13CF652).  State did not have enough time to subpoena witnesses.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Darnell Stith in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING / ARRAIGNMENT  (17 pages) commencing  JUNE 9, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Darnell Stith in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Kevin Shomin for Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Amy Bartol-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Court ordered NO ILLEGAL DRUGS.

Defendant Darnell Stith in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Dax C Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5-30-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
